newsitem.title: LEBANON: SOLIDERE shares mixed in Beirut.
newsitem.headline: SOLIDERE shares mixed in Beirut.

text.p: SOLIDERE shares were mixed on increased turnover on Wednesday on the privately-operated Beirut Secondary Market (BSM).
A shares -- distributed to former holders of property rights in the Beirut central district SOLIDERE is rebuilding -- rose to $105 from $104.0 on Tuesday.
B shares -- issued in a $650-million subscription in January 1994 -- held steady at $106.25.
Turnover on BSM, which trades only SOLIDERE shares, rose to 10,111 shares from Tuesday's 9,582 and value was $1,076,582 from $1,006,696.
There was no trade on the Beirut Stock Exchange (BSE) in any of the listed companies: Ciments Libanais, Ciments Blancs, Eternit and Uniceramic.
The BLOM Stock Index which covers both markets rose 0.53 percent to 907.18 and the LISPI index also rose 0.14 percent to 81.89.
